meanings.definition: To give special importance or prominence to something.
meanings.sent1: In her speech, she emphasised the need for kindness.
meanings.sent2: The teacher emphasised the importance of studying for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat emphasised its hunger by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The bright red sign emphasised the entrance to the park.
meanings.sent5: The bold font emphasised the title on the cover.

meanings.sent1: He emphasised the key points during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The coach emphasised the need for teamwork in sports.
meanings.sent3: The clown emphasised his funny hat by wearing oversized shoes.
meanings.sent4: The thunder emphasised the power of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight emphasised the lead singer on stage.

meanings.definition: To make something stand out or be more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: The artist emphasised the colors in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The new lighting emphasised the architecture of the building.
meanings.sent3: The chef emphasised the flavor of the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent4: The contrast in the photo emphasised the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The music emphasised the emotions in the movie scene.
